newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Howard comfortable on Australia jobs estimate.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Howard comfortable on Australia jobs estimate.

text.p: Australian Prime Minister John Howard said on Tuesday it would take time to see an improvement in Australia's unemployment rate but he was still comfortable with the jobless forecasts contained in the 1996/97 budget.

"I want to see a change, I want to see an improvement, it will take time and policies must be allowed to be implemented and then they must be allowed to work before one can make a fair assessment of the impact of those policies," he tolds reporters.
"I do not set specific targets, either numerical ones or time ones," Howard said.

Asked if he was still comfortable with the budget forecast of an 8.25 percent unemployment rate by June 1997, Howard said he had no evidence put to him that could suggest he ought to change any of the budget estimates.
Australia's seasonally adjusted unemployment rate stood at 8.7 percent in September.
